newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Surgical in vendor pact with Health Services.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Surgical in vendor pact with Health Services.

text.p: United States Surgical Corp. said Friday it signed a new five-year vendor agreement with Health Services Corp. of America covering all its stapling, laparoscopic and suture products.
Effective June 1, the new agreement covers more than 960 hospitals served by Health Services Corp. and is expected to generate nearly $300 million in sales over the next five years.
Health Services Corp is a Cape Girardeau, Mo.-based health care group purchasing organisation.

On Thursday, Norwlk, Conn.-based U.S. Surgical said it signed a new five-year contract to provide AmeriNet Inc. with stapling, laparoscopic and suture products estimated to generate sales of about $100 million a year.
The contract is effective June 1 and covers more than 2,000 hospitals for which AmeriNet provides group purchasing services, the company said.
U.S. Surgical stock was up 50 cents at $32 in morning trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
